paper_abstract: A verifiable secret sharing is a secret sharing scheme with an untrusted dealer that allows participants to verify validity of their own shares. A publicly verifiable secret sharing (PVSS) scheme is a verifiable secret sharing scheme that allows a third party to verify correctness of the distributed shares. We propose an efficient non-interactive PVSS scheme using Paillier additively homomorphic encryption system, and analyze its security in a model that we define in line with the classic semantic-security definition and offering stronger security compared to the previous models. We reduce security of our PVSS scheme to the well studied decisional composite residuosity assumption in this model.
